awd_titl_txt: 26th NSF EPSCoR National Conference: Science and Partnerships Across Disciplinary Boundaries
awd_abstract_narration:
Nontechnical Description 

The Established Program to Stimulate Competitive Research (EPSCoR) holds National Conferences that bring representatives from all EPSCoR jurisdictions together to discuss strategies to promote EPSCoR goals of building STEM research and education capacity to increase their national competitiveness. This biennial event is a forum for EPSCoR project directors and participants to discuss opportunities and challenges at the local, state, national, and international levels and how EPSCoR efforts can collectively contribute to the advancement of science and engineering research and education. This meeting also showcases results from projects funded by NSF EPSCoR. The 26th National EPSCoR Conference will be held in Columbia, South Carolina from October 27-30, 2019 and is expected to have 300-400 attendees. This meeting is organized by South Carolina EPSCoR with a focus on transdisciplinary science and education. 

Technical Description 

The theme for the 26th National EPSCoR Conference is "Science and Partnerships across Disciplinary Boundaries". The program will include five sub-themes to provide a organizing framework for the meeting: 1) Promoting transdisciplinary research and education through NSF EPSCoR investments; 2) Broadening participation in STEM through partnerships; 3) Promoting public-private partnerships in education and research leading to economic competitiveness; 4) Big data in a transdisciplinary perspective: crossing boundaries; and 5) Evaluating transdisciplinary research and conveying its importance to a broader audience.  The National Conference will showcase high-impact programs and explore the elements and strategies that make them successful over the long-term in their capacity for scientific and economic advancement. The conference program will include platform and poster sessions to encourage the active participation of EPSCoR awardees - Principal Investigators, Project Administrators, Education, Outreach, Diversity Coordinators as well as other senior personnel and early-career researchers (including students).  Plenary sessions featuring national experts will highlight different aspects of the meeting theme.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

por.por_cntn:
The NSF Award #OIA-184110 supported the 26th NSF EPSCoR National Conference and the 2022 NSF EPSCoR Education, Outreach, and Diversity (EOD) Conference. The overarching goals of the 26th NSF EPSCoR National Conference are as follows:

  1. Bring researchers, project directors, leaders, and students from all EPSCoR jurisdictions together to discuss strategies and best practices to promote EPSCoR goals of building STEM transdisciplinary research and education across all these states.
  2. Feature various projects that are currently funded under the EPSCoR program.
  3. Provide an opportunity for all participants to gather more information on NSF?s strategic plan and priority areas directly from NSF leadership.
  4. Provide an opportunity to showcase the impact of EPSCoR programs on these states and beyond the participating jurisdictions.
  5. Showcase the broad collaborative opportunities provided by EPSCoR programs between comprehensive research universities, predominantly undergraduate institutions, historically black colleges and universities (HBCUs), technical colleges, K-12, industry, and the like, and their impact on respective jurisdictions and the nation.
  6. Develop strategies to promote the importance of research partnerships across and beyond disciplinary boundaries. 
  7. Help identify the barriers and develop best practices to implement convergence research. 

The 26th NSF EPSCoR National Conference took place on October 27-30, 2019, at the Columbia Metropolitan Convention Center in Columbia, SC. There were 411 attendees representing all EPSCoR jurisdictions. The conference featured plenary and keynote speakers, lightning talks, featured talks, panel discussions, breakout session, workshops, and poster sessions. In addition, the conference included a Welcome Reception at the Columbia Museum of Art, and a Closing Reception at the UofSC Pastides Alumni Center. The PD/PA/EOD meeting was held on the day after the conclusion of the main conference.

The conference was attended by project directors, project administrators, education and outreach directors, university and college administrators, faculty postdocs, graduate students and undergraduate students. In addition, the meeting was also attended by state committee members, technical and non-technical staff, advisory board members and associate program directors, among others.

The meeting was attended by almost 100 undergraduate and graduate students, as well as 15 RII Track-4 PIs. In addition, 52 attendees represented Minority Serving Institutions, including HBCUs (29), Hispanic-Serving Institutions (14), Tribal Colleges and Universities (1) and Asian American and Native American Pacific Islander-Serving Institutions (8). Also, 6 attendees represented community colleges (1 community college is also a Hispanic-Serving Institution).

The overarching goals of the 2022 NSF EPSCoR EOD Conference are as follows:

  1. Bring together individuals working with and managing EOD programs and initiatives, individuals wanting to learn more about EOD and best practices, and science communications professionals in EPSCoR jurisdictions.
  2. Provide singular focus on the challenges, success stories, and best practices in STEM Education, Outreach, Diversity, and Science Communication.
  3. Provide oral presentation opportunities to share research and practices in STEM Education, Outreach, Diversity, and Science Communication.
  4. Feature poster presentations focusing on STEM Education, Outreach, Diversity, and Science Communication.
  5. Provide an environment to foster collaborations and networks.
  6. Gather data to chart a path forward for future NSF EPSCoR EOD Conferences and spin-off EPSCoR workshops and meetings.

The 2022 NSF EPSCoR EOD Conference was held September 11-14, 2022 at the Wild Dunes Resort in Isle of Palms, South Carolina. There were 119 conference attendees representing 21 EPSCoR jurisdictions and 4 Non-EPSCoR jurisdictions (Florida, Washington, DC, Tennessee, North Carolina). The conference featured Plenary Sessions, Panel Sessions, Concurrent Sessions, Poster Sessions, HBCU session, and Meet the NSF Program Directors sessions. The conference began with a Welcome Reception on Sunday, September 11, 2022.

The 2022 NSF EPSCoR EOD Conference focused on the following topics:

 

  • STEM Education
  • Diversity
  • Science Communication
  • Broad EOD (Education, Outreach, and Diversity)

The conference was attended by EOD staff, communications staff, project directors, project administrators, VPRs, Associate VPRs, Assistant VPRs, Deans, Department Chairs, university administrators, faculty, other staff, researchers, practitioners, students, and other STEM professionals. The conference was also attended by NSF OIA Office Head, NSF EPSCoR Section Head, and NSF Program Directors from the EPSCoR Section, TIPS Directorate, and EEC Division.

The 2022 NSF EPSCoR EOD Conference featured:

  • 9 Plenary Sessions
  • 2 Panel Sessions
  • 25 Concurrent Sessions
  • 2 Poster Sessions
  • 2 Meet the NSF Program Directors Sessions
  • 1 HBCU Session

Both conferences facilitated training and professional development opportunities for conference attendees.
